children.step: Gather Ingredients and Equipment
Create a comprehensive grocery list based on the recipe.
Identify all ingredients in the recipe.
Locate the recipe document or digital version.
Carefully read through the entire recipe, paying close attention to each instruction.
Identify all individual ingredients listed in the recipe.
Record each ingredient on a separate line or in a list.
Note any quantities associated with each ingredient (e.g., 1 cup, 2 tablespoons, 1/2 teaspoon).
Verify the spelling and accuracy of each ingredient name.
Compile a complete list of all ingredients, including quantities, in a consistent format.
Check existing pantry inventory to identify items already owned.
For each ingredient in the recipe, note the required quantity (e.g., 1 cup, 2 lbs).
Determine the unit of measurement for each ingredient (e.g., grams, ounces, milliliters).
Add each ingredient to the grocery list with its specified quantity and unit of measurement.
Organize the grocery list by grocery store section (e.g., produce, dairy, meat, canned goods).
Review the completed grocery list for accuracy and completeness.
Check existing pantry and refrigerator inventory to identify items already available.
Visit the grocery store or order ingredients online.
Carefully select each ingredient, ensuring freshness and quality.
Purchase any necessary equipment or tools required for the recipe (e.g., knives, pots, pans).
Inspect all purchased ingredients and equipment for any damage or defects.
Organize the gathered ingredients and equipment in a logical manner for easy access during preparation.
Activate Yeast
Combine Wet Ingredients
Combine Dry Ingredients
Mix Dough
First Rise
Shape Loaf and Second Rise
Bake Bread
